com.camerontec.catalys.server.sessionmanager

Class ServerConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.sessionmanager.ServerConnectionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable, IManagedThreadCallbacks

    public class ServerConnectionManager
extends ComponentHelper
implements IManagedThreadCallbacks
    Listens for connections on given port. On receiving connection, creates anonymous session and waits for a logon message. When the party associated with the session is identified, it configures the session for that party and then hands the session to its manager. The manager will run the session in its own thread. NOTE that a server connection with the same port can have more than one session associated with it (different configurations).

    NOTE The configuration validator checks that the FAST related configurations are the same for all sessions. The same applies for message length and dialectNoLengthOnRawData. In the past these checks use to happen here.

    NOTE - When configuration is reloaded the same check is done again by the ConfigurationValidator.

      • setLogDetailedInboundConnectionEvents

        public static void setLogDetailedInboundConnectionEvents(boolean logDetailedInboundConnectionEvents)
        Determines whether when a client connects to the CatalysServer on a listening port (say 2000), the relevant IConnectionPoint details for the configured parties on that port are logged. The logs will look like:

        ServerConnectionManager: Received connection from /127.0.0.1:54391 into local port 2000
        ServerConnectionManager:2000 - These are the parties configured for listening local port 2000:
        ServerConnectionManager:2000 - ApplicationID: sell
        ServerConnectionManager:2000 - Local Party (compID, subID, locationID): Fats Fast Market, -, -
        ServerConnectionManager:2000 - External Party (compID, subID, locationID): Bigbroker, -, -

        These logs are useful to sysadmins to determine the other end of a connection should it not succeed to send the Logon message. Default is "false" for all managed listen ports

        Parameters:
        logDetailedInboundConnectionEvents - whether to log detailed inbound connection events

      • getLogDetailedInboundConnectionEvents

        public static boolean getLogDetailedInboundConnectionEvents()
        Returns:
        the value for the flag set with setLogDetailedInboundConnectionEvents(boolean)
